events.message: Customer submitted a claim reporting a car collision that occurred late last night at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the keywords describing a vehicle collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned promptly to handle the customer's accident case.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and informed the customer.
Customer was asked to provide the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and witness statements.
Customer submitted all required documents including accident photos, police report, and repair estimates.
Investigation began to verify the details of the collision and assess liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded determining the other driver was at fault and the damage is fully covered.
A settlement offer including repair costs and rental vehicle reimbursement was proposed to the customer.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with claim handling.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement offer terms.
Payment for vehicle repairs and rental coverage was issued successfully to the claimant's account.
The auto accident claim was closed after completion of payment and confirmation from the customer.
All documentation and claim records were archived securely in the company's system for future reference.
